greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: The smallest k that is a Rhonda number in exactly n bases.
comment: n is a Rhonda number in base B if the product of its digits in base B is equal to B times the sum of its prime factors (with multiplicity).
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Rhonda Number
example: Finally, we have 78*60=130*36, 58*108=174*36, 42*204=238*36 and no smaller number is a Rhonda number w.r.t. exactly 3 bases.
results.author: _Giovanni Resta_, Oct 17 2012
